interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Jesse Stone: Night Passage
Review Date: 2019/11/16
Store: Tom Selleck  (Actor),     Stephen Baldwin  (Actor),     Robert Harmon  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'A prequel to "Stone Cold" in the series of Jesse Stone novels by Robert B. Parker, the story picks up after Jesse Stone is fired from the Los Angeles Police Department. He becomes an unlikely candidate recruited by the town board of selectman to become police chief of Paradise, a small town on Boston\'s North Shore. The board hopes his failed experience will keep him from digging too deep into the town\'s secrets. Hungover on his first day on the job, he must investigate a domestic abuse case that ends up leaduing to a money laundering scheme perpetuated by a manager of a local bank.', 'Amazon.com', "How Tom Selleck's world-weary cop Jesse Stone became the police chief of sleepy Paradise, Mass., is revealed in this engaging prequel to the first made-for-TV Stone feature,", 'Stone Cold', "(2005). Selleck is once again well cast as the rough-around-the-edges Stone, whose drinking problem gets him ejected from the Los Angeles police force; he soon finds himself the head lawman in a small New England fishing village, where his slow dissolution continues until a routine domestic disturbance case reveals connections to money laundering and murder, with several of the town's most affluent names as possible suspects. Selleck is well-matched by veteran scene stealer Saul Rubinek, and there's good work by Polly Shannon as a city attorney who becomes Stone's romantic interest, and Stephen Baldwin as an ill-tempered local. Fans of author Robert B. Parker (on whose books the Jesse Stone films are based) and Selleck won't be disappointed by this smart thriller.", '--Paul Gaita']
Average Rating: 4.8

Paint Your Wagon
Clint Eastwood  (Actor),     Harve Presnell  (Actor),     Joshua Logan  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Westerns
['Alan J. Lerner and Frederick Loewe\'s 1951 Broadway smash became the first and only musical undertaking for Clint Eastwood, who stars alongside Lee Marvin as two corners of a love triangle involved with beautiful Jean Seberg and partners in a bizarre financial enterprise in Gold Rush-era California. Songs include "They Call the Wind Maria," "I Talk to the Trees," and "I\'m on My Way"; directed by Joshua Logan. 164 min. Widescreen (Enhanced); Soundtracks: English Dolby Digital 5.1, Dolby Digital Surround, French Dolby Digital mono; Subtitles: English; theatrical trailer.']

The Shadow Riders
Tom Selleck  (Actor),     Sam Elliott  (Actor),     Andrew McLaglen  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
["The Civil War is over and the Traven brothers are going home. But what Mac (Tom Selleck, Quigley Down Under) and Dal (Sam Elliott, Tombstone) find upon their arrival is a town ravaged by Confederate rebels who've refused to surrender. Swearing to fight the Yankees to the bitter end, the guerillas have kidnapped the Travens' younger sisters - as well as Dal's sweetheart, Kate (Katharine Ross, Shenandoah) - and plan to sell them to a brothel in Mexico to raise money for guns and bullets. Determined to rescue their loved ones, Mac and Dal bust their Uncle Black Jack (Oscar(r) winner Ben Johnson, Best Actor in a Supporting Role, The Last Picture Show, 1971) out of prison and head south of the border, where they aim to finish a war they thought had already ended."]
{'Genre': 'Action, Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Dubbed', 'Contributor': 'Dennis Durney, Tom Selleck, Ben Johnson, Geoffrey Lewis, Sam Elliott, Pegasus Group, Ltd./CPT, Katharine Ross, Gene Evans, Verne Nobles, Jeffrey Osterhage, Andrew McLaglenDennis Durney, Tom Selleck, Ben Johnson, Geoffrey Lewis, Sam Elliott, Pegasus Group, Ltd./CPT, Katharine Ross, Gene Evans, Verne Nobles, Jeffrey Osterhage, Andrew McLaglen  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, French (Mono)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2856761', 'Director': 'Andrew McLaglen', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Dubbed', 'Run time': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 13, 2008', 'Actors': 'Tom Selleck, Sam Elliott, Ben Johnson, Geoffrey Lewis, Jeffrey Osterhage', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Producers': 'Verne Nobles, Dennis Durney', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}

Hungover on his first day on the job, he must investigate a domestic abuse case that ends up leaduing to a money laundering scheme perpetuated by a manager of a local bank.', 'Amazon.com', "How Tom Selleck's world-weary cop Jesse Stone became the police chief of sleepy Paradise, Mass., is revealed in this engaging prequel to the first made-for-TV Stone feature,", 'Stone Cold', "(2005). profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preferences:** The user maintains a strong interest in classic films, particularly Westerns and musicals, while increasingly enjoying comedy and high-quality action-adventure genres. This includes narratives with classic Western influences as well as engaging drama and mystery elements.
  
- **Genre Appreciation:** They particularly favor musicals with romantic or comedic elements in historical settings, alongside well-executed dramas that highlight established actors, showcasing an appreciation for storytelling with depth.

- **Format Preference:** The user continues to favor DVD format, highlighting a consistent preference for physical media that ensures high picture and sound quality.

- **Quality Concern:** They exhibit significant concern for overall product quality, leading to selective purchases. Positive past experiences reinforce this preference for reliable media, which remains a priority.

- **Rating Behavior:** Frequently awards high ratings, indicating a discerning taste for quality films, performances, and production values. The most recent interactions exemplify their continued emphasis on high standards in their evaluations.

- **Emotional Engagement:** Their reviews are emotionally expressive, integrating personal insights with product assessments, often using emojis to enhance the communication style.

- **Collectors’ Interest:** The user exhibits an ongoing interest in collecting high-quality films, particularly iconic titles that bridge across classic, comedic, and action genres, maintaining a focus on craftsmanship and notable talent. 

Overall, this user showcases a sophisticated, well-rounded taste for cinema, emphasizing quality and engagement in their media experiences.
